result.execSummary:
The defendant Brian Keith Perry was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: Consecutive to: any other sentence; release ONLY for  work, inmate work assignments, and  The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 3 days (04-22-2015 to 04-24-15) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring.

miscConds.notes:
Fine is set at ZERO.
Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered.

No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.
No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.

Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
Drivers license suspension is not imposed.

Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Brian Keith Perry

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
4/24/15.

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  
AS TO COUNT  1 -
Court ordered defendant to serve 170 DAYS in the House of Correction consecutive to any other sentence; release ONLY for  work, inmate work assignments, and  The Day Reporting Center; with credit for 3 days (04-22-2015 to 04-24-15) time served. Court notes a strong objection to electronic monitoring. 

COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed defendant on probation for 12 MONTHS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Maintain Absolute Sobriety: No use or possession/use of alcohol or controlled substances without a valid prescription taken in the manner and fashion as prescribed.
- Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment.  
- Department of Corrections must conduct drug and alcohol testing
- No possession of any drug paraphernalia for personal use, manufacturing, delivering or for distribution.
- No possession of any firearms or weapons, firearm ammunition, firearm magazine, firearm holster, or any body armor.
- Maintain fulltime employment. 
- Court ordered Defendant to comply with all child support court orders.
- Fine is set at ZERO.
- Drivers license suspension is not imposed.
- Provide DNA sample, if not already done. 
- Pay all mandatory court costs, fees, assessments and surcharges, including the DNA surcharge, during the course of probation to the probation agent. Cash bail to apply. Any remaining balance due at the end of probation will become immediately due or civil judgment to be entered. 

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting.

Appellate rights notice given to the defendant. 

Filed;
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief;
Pretrial Incarceration Credit.

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz. Brandon Wigley on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.

AS TO COUNT 1:

The defendant was advised of his Constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights, Jury Instructions and Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights received and filed.  The parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  The Court found the defendant guilty and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.

Pursuant to Wisconsin Statutes section 973.176, the Court advised the defendant of the following restrictions:  Firearm possession and Voting. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 

Case proceeded to sentencing hearing.
From friends and family on behalf of Brian Perry received and filed.  Deputy Court Clerk: KAR.

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz. Danielle Chojnacki on behalf of Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Case set for motion hearing. Defense moves to withdraw motion and request case set for projected plea and sentencing hearing. Case adjourned for projected plea and sentencing on 10-19-2015 at 8:30 am, branch 17.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.
State's Response to Defendant's Motion to Suppress with attached cover letter, received and filed. tk

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Paul M. Hauer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.
Scheduling conference held. Court orders case adjourned for Motion Hearing on 10-01-2015 at 01:30, Branch 17.  Response due no later than 08-28-2015 by 5:00 pm.  Parties notified that effective August 1, 2015, Branch 17 will be located in the Safety Building, room 310.  Motion hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 01:30 pm.  Calendar call scheduled for August 28, 2015 at 05:00 pm.

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Konkol.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Stark, Br. 17.

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel has filed a motion.  Court advised parties that as of August 3, 2015, this case will be reassigned to Judge Daniel Konkol, Branch 44 in Room 316 of the Safety Bldg.  Substitution filed.  Case assigned to Judge Stark.  Court contacted Judge Stark's clerk for the next court date.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/23/22015 at 8:30 am, branch 17, in room 313 of the safety building.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 23, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's motion to suppress, received and filed.  aw

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Zachary A Wittchow appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defense counsel wants to file a motion.  Case adjourned for scheduling conference on 7/8/2015 at 8:30 am, branch 3.  Court reminds defendant to not use or possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription.  aw  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Nathaniel Adamson for Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Fiorenza, Branch 03.  Original Information filed.  Copy given to defense counsel who waived reading.  Defendant pleads not guilty.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for 06-11-2015 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Brian Keith Perry

Prior: 5821 North 66th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53218

No drugs without a valid prescription

Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Brian Keith Perry in court with attorney Jason Daniel Baltz.  Ronald Dague appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
